@graph.name: Teriyaki Chicken {Easy 15 Minute Recipe} - Cooking Classy
@graph.description: This Teriyaki Chicken recipe will quickly become a new favorite! In this one pan recipe, bite size chicken breasts pieces are sautéed in a skillet then coated with an easy and delicious teriyaki sauce. Perfect recipe for busy weeknights!

@graph.name: Teriyaki Chicken
@graph.description: This Teriyaki Chicken recipe will quickly become a new favorite! In this one pan recipe, bite size chicken breasts pieces are sautéed in a skillet then coated with an easy and delicious teriyaki sauce. To make this a 15 minute recipe prep the sauce mixture while the chicken is cooking.

video.name: Teriyaki Chicken
video.description: 15 Minute Chicken Teriyaki - In this one pan recipe, bite size chicken breasts pieces are sautéed in a skillet then coated with an easy and delicious teriyaki sauce.

recipeIngredient: 1 1/4 lbs. boneless skinless chicken breasts, (diced into 1-inch cubes)
2 tsp peeled and minced fresh ginger
2 tsp peeled and minced fresh garlic ((2 cloves))
Sesame seeds and chopped green onions, (for serving (optional))

recipeInstructions.text: Heat olive oil in a 12-inch non-stick skillet over medium-high heat.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat olive oil in a 12-inch non-stick skillet over medium-high heat.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in chicken and let brown on bottom about 3 - 4 minutes then flip and continue to cook until center registers about 160 degrees, about 3 minutes longer.
recipeInstructions.name: Add in chicken and let brown on bottom about 3 - 4 minutes then flip and continue to cook until center registers about 160 degrees, about 3 minutes longer.

recipeInstructions.text: While chicken is cooking, in a small mixing bowl (or liquid measuring cup) whisk together soy sauce, water, honey, brown sugar, rice vinegar, sesame oil, ginger, garlic and cornstarch.
recipeInstructions.name: While chicken is cooking, in a small mixing bowl (or liquid measuring cup) whisk together soy sauce, water, honey, brown sugar, rice vinegar, sesame oil, ginger, garlic and cornstarch.

recipeInstructions.text: Stir the sauce in with the cooked chicken and continue to cook and toss until sauce has thickened, about 30 - 60 seconds longer.
recipeInstructions.name: Stir the sauce in with the cooked chicken and continue to cook and toss until sauce has thickened, about 30 - 60 seconds longer.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve warm garnished with green onions and sesame seeds if desired.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve warm garnished with green onions and sesame seeds if desired.
